com.poesys.db.dao.query

Class QueryMemcachedByKey<T extends IDbDto>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dao.query.QueryByKey<T>
      • com.poesys.db.dao.query.QueryMemcachedByKey<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of IDbDto to query
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQueryByKey<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QueryDatabaseMemcachedByKey

    public class QueryMemcachedByKey<T extends IDbDto>
extends QueryByKey<T>
implements IQueryByKey<T>
    An implementation of the IQueryByKey interface that implements the basic elements of a query by primary key including caching in the distributed memcached server. If the object is already cached, the queryByKey method de-serializes it and returns it without querying; if the object is not cached, the method queries and caches the object. This subclass overrides the queryByKey method to add caching to the logic; the code replaces all the code in the superclass as the code must run in a separate tracking thread.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

        Create a QueryMemcachedByKey object with the appropriate SQL class, the subsystem that contains the T class, and the memcached expiration time for objects of type T in the cache.
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement specification
        subsystem - the subsystem name for the subsystem containing the T class
        expiration - the memcached expiration time in milliseconds for the cached object
